headline: Alphabet’s AI Chips Are a Potential $900 Billion ‘Secret Sauce’
summary: The success of Alphabet’s tensor processing unit, or TPU, chips is a primary reason for the stock’s 31% fourth-quarter rally, which is the tenth best performance in the S&P 500 Index.  The TPUs were always seen as a major strength internally, accelerating growth for the company’s cloud-computing business.

headline: HPE Announces Sale of Its Remaining H3C Stake for $643 Million
summary: Hewlett-Packard Enterprise Company (NYSE:HPE) is one of the AI Stocks in Focus This Week. On December 1, Evercore ISI analyst Amit Daryanani reiterated an Outperform rating on the stock with a $28.00 price target. The firm is positive on the stock following the sale of its remaining 9% stake in H3C, seeing the divesture as […]

headline: Stocks to Watch Thursday: Salesforce, Kroger, Snowflake
summary: ↗️ Salesforce (CRM): The software company's shares gained 5% in offhours trading after it raised full-year guidance, saying its AI product is gaining traction. ↘️Snowflake (SNOW): The cloud-software company's shares fell sharply in out-of-hours trading after it posted a narrowed quarterly loss and reported growing demand for its own AI agent.

headline: Retail Earnings, Inflation Data: What to Watch for the Rest of This Week
summary: Today brings another batch of earnings, including from the retailers Kroger, Dollar General and Ulta Beauty. Key economic data will include a delayed September reading of the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge, due Friday.

headline: Traefik Labs Joins HPE Unleash AI Partner Program to Deliver Sovereign AI Infrastructure with Triple Gate Security Architecture
summary: BARCELONA, Spain, December 04, 2025--Traefik Labs today announced it has joined the HPE Unleash AI partner program, bringing its Triple Gate security architecture to HPE Private Cloud AI.

headline: What CrowdStrike Holdings (CRWD)'s Strong Q3 Revenue and New AI Alliances Mean For Shareholders
summary: CrowdStrike Holdings reported past third-quarter 2025 results with revenue rising to US$1,234.24 million while net loss widened to US$34 million, alongside higher full-year revenue guidance and new fourth-quarter revenue expectations. At the same time, the company deepened its role in AI-driven and cloud security through expanded partnerships with AWS, HPE, and Kroll, plus new Falcon platform and cloud detection innovations that emphasize agentic AI and managed detection and response...

headline: Fortanix Teams with HPE and NVIDIA to Embed Confidential Computing in AI Factories
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., December 04, 2025--Fortanix® Inc., a global leader in data security for an AI world, today announced its hyper-secure platform – Armet AI – can be deployed on HPE’s AI solutions, combining secure infrastructure and accelerated computing for scalable, production-ready AI. Global enterprises can leverage HPE ProLiant Compute DL380a Gen12 servers and NVIDIA RTX PRO™ 6000 Blackwell Server Edition GPUs to build and run secure, scalable AI workloads on-premises, in the cloud and i

headline: Dollar General earnings, Fedspeak, jobless claims: What to Watch
summary: Asking for a Trend host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Thursday, December 4, including earnings results from Dollar General (DG), Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), and Ulta Beauty (ULTA); commentary from Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman; and the latest reading on initial jobless claims. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.
